Line 64: Line 64:
== Tools ==
== Tools ==
=== Boot media ===
=== Boot media ===
â
It is often the case that data recovery and forensics operations cannot be done on a running system. As a result, it is common to use a specialized [[boot disk]], [[Live CD]], [[Live USB]], or any other type of [[LiveDistro]] containing a minimal operating system and a set of repair tools. When [[floppy disk|floppy drives]] were still common, the boot disk was typically a very minimal LiveDistro on a floppy disk (such as the [[Mac OS]] Classic ''Disk Tools'' disk, standard with every system release). However, as operating system complexity has increased, it has become more common for developers to include recovery tools on the same media as the OS installer. There are also many purpose-built LiveDistros that include advanced data recovery and forensics tools.
+
It is often the case that data recovery and forensics operations cannot be done on a running system. As a result, it is common to use a specialized [[boot disk]], [[Live CD]], [[Live USB]], or any other type of [[Live Distro]] containing a minimal operating system and a set of repair tools. When [[floppy disk|floppy drives]] were still common, the boot disk was typically a very minimal Live Distro on a floppy disk (such as the [[Mac OS]] Classic ''Disk Tools'' disk, standard with every system release). However, as operating system complexity has increased, it has become more common for developers to include recovery tools on the same media as the OS installer. There are also many purpose-built Live Distros that include advanced data recovery and forensics tools.
{{main|List of LiveDistros}}
{{main|List of LiveDistros}}
